summary: This is a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team seeking to exclude five specific government exhibits from her criminal trial. The motion argues the exhibits (photographs of a child, a sex toy box, a photograph of Maxwell, and a household manual) are irrelevant, lack foundation, are hearsay, and are unfairly prejudicial. It provides legal arguments under Federal Rules of Evidence 401, 403, and 404(b).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, filing a motion to exclude evidence. Her defense attorneys are arguing the proffered exhibits are irrelevant and prejudicial.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from HADDON MORGAN & FOREMAN P.C., signed the motion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as Maxwell's associate. The motion argues exhibits related to him (photographs of his girlfriend's child, items seized from his home) are not probative of Maxwell's guilt and are prejudicial.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons

connections.description: The motion references the government's attempt to establish an intimate relationship between Maxwell and Epstein and to associate her with items seized from his properties.
Pagliuca is listed as an attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell and signed the motion on her behalf.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Palm Beach Home
events.description: Execution of a search warrant at 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida, during which items including a box labeled "Twin Torpedos" (Gov't Exhibit 294) were seized.

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York Home
events.description: A search of Jeffrey Epstein's house, during which a DVD containing a photograph of Ghislaine Maxwell (Gov't Exhibit 313) was purportedly seized from a binder on a shelf.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Preclude Evidence
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files this motion requesting the court exclude five specific government exhibits from her upcoming trial.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida
Southern District of New York (court jurisdiction)
keyFacts: The defense seeks to exclude Government Exhibits 251, 288, 294, 313, and 606, arguing they are irrelevant, lack foundation, and are unfairly prejudicial.

Exhibit 251 and 288 are photographs of a young child, described as the daughter of Jeffrey Epstein's former girlfriend and her husband. The defense argues they are not child pornography and have no nexus to Maxwell.

Exhibit 294 is a box labeled "Twin Torpedos," a sex toy seized from Epstein's Palm Beach home in 2005. The defense argues it was seized after the alleged conspiracy and no witness links it to Maxwell.
Exhibit 313 is a photograph of Maxwell found on a DVD in Epstein's home during a 2012 search. The defense argues it has no nexus to the case's allegations.
Exhibit 606 is a "Household Manual" dated 2/14/2005. The defense argues it is hearsay, unauthenticated, created after the indictment's events, and not created by Maxwell.
